title: Ticket #1488: New classads doesn't implement debug() function
description:
The classad debug() function, as described in our manual, is not implemented in new classads and therefore is not available for the 7.5.x series of Condor.

It should be implemented.
remarks:
2010-Oct-20 16:03:30 by jfrey:
Bulk change of target version from v070504 to v070505 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Jan-27 14:46:04 by danb:
Bulk change of target version from v070505 to v070506 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Feb-01 16:08:44 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.

2011-May-17 20:28:30 by slauson:
Attached a patch with what I was able to complete last week. I was able to get similar functionality with the old classads debug function. However, I wasn't able to have the debugging information printed in the daemon logs. It currently prints out to a static file "debug.out". Some more work and testing is needed before this is complete.

Sample Expression: 

START = debug(expression == 2 && (OpSys == "LINUX") && random(1) == 0)
Sample Output: 
Classad debug: expression --> UNDEFINED
Classad debug: OpSys --> LINUX
Classad debug: random(1) --> 0
Classad debug: expression == 2 && ( OpSys == "LINUX" ) && random(1) == 0 --> UNDEFINED


Classad debug: expression --> 2
Classad debug: true && expression == 2 --> 1

2011-Jun-06 14:42:38 by psilord:
I have an issue with this patch: 

void
classad_debug_dprintf (const char *s) {
     dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, s);
}

If I wanted to print out a classad expression that looked like this: 

foo = "hello %s"

Then will the above dprintf erroneously pick something off the stack?

Should the code be: 

    dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "%s", s);

instead?

2011-Jun-06 14:43:34 by psilord:
I punted it back to review, since I think the issue I raised need it.

2011-Jun-06 16:30:26 by psilord:
gthain pushed a patch. I'm satisfied.
